creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture
description: seated figure holding small branch with opening leaves and four red berries; halo around head; standing figure in LL with hand over girl with head down over deskin foreground
medium: Ink, color, and gold leaf on silk
text: This painting was part of a set of 16 rakan. The Clark collections held five, two are at the Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York, another two are at the Brooklyn Museum of Art, and one is at the Cleveland Museum of Art. The remaining six are lost.
title: Rakan with Bodhisattva
